ygData.subject: RE: What to do with a level 24?
ygData.msgSnippet: I never had any problems with returning form the arena and it is a lot closer. (by a factor of 5 or 6, west Karana is BIG)  You need to climb the west wall
ygData.messageBody:
I never had any problems with returning form the arena and it is a lot
closer. (by a factor of 5 or 6, west Karana is BIG) You need to
climb the west wall around the undead area near the zone border and
have accelardo going since you occasionally get attacked there but I
always made it to zone NP. (scout the route ahead of time so you know
the way) In S. Karana you are so close to the village and most the of
mobs are non-aggro that getting your body is very easy. The only real
danger is running into a named frogie in the water of rath lake. It
is a very rare event (never happened to me) but I suggest having your
swimming trained up and play acccelardo while you swim just in case.
It takes over 20 minutes to run to the aviak village from Qeynos (even
with a drum) where the arena is only about 2 minutes away. No
question in my mind, get bound in the arena.

another hint, you can sell you stuff at the centaur village in the NE
corner of S. Karana. Saves that long run back to Qeynos to sell. Now
if the centaurs only had a bank... )

Bujold 20th (the slowest leveler in EQ)
Xegony


______________________________ Reply Separator _________________________________
Subject: RE: [eqbards] What to do with a level 24?
Author: Non-HP-g4mntofcr (g4mntofcr@...) at
HP-ColSprings,shargw5
Date: 9/20/99 2:46 PM


From: "Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4" <g4mntofcr@...>

For bards who hunt in South Karana, is it best to get bound in the Arena or
in Qeynos? The Arena may be quicker in terms of getting back to your corpse
but you won't have a flute to sing invis song (to avoid getting attacked as
you run back to your corpse). Is this something I should be concerned with
or will the wandering mobs in SK leave me alone?

Galtin

> Also if you are hunting Aviaks you want to have a Ranger in your group.
> Since on my server (Karana) the Treehouse is majorly camped, but there are
>
> many wandering Avaiks in the area between the Treehouse and Paw. When I
> used to slow there I would just zoom around with Selo's till I found one.
>
> This was still quicker (and more fun) then fighting over the static spawn
> at
> the Treehouse :)
>
> >
> >Myself and another bard on my server, seem to be doing well in South
> Karana
> >fighting Aviaks in and around the Aviak City... We can solo Darters and
> >Rooks, and in groups we can take harriers and Avocets, these things are
> >rich
> >also. I went from just hitting 21 to well into 23 so far in a couple of
> >days.
> >
> >
